sys_hub_flow.name: On-Call Assign by Acknowledgement

sys_hub_flow.description:
Post Actionable Message.

Inputs:

  • Record SysID - SysID of Record.
  • Template - Please select the template, from which Slack Messages are displayed.
  • Channel ID - Unique ID of the channel or user.
  • User ID - Select user from sys_user table.
  • Additional Message - Any additional message with the approval details.
  • Icon - Sender icon emoji to be shown in the channel/DM. For example- :male-technologist:
  • Username - Sender name to be shown in the channel.
  • Context ID - Extra params.

Outputs:

  • Status - If the request is executed successfully. Status is set to "Success". If there is a failure in Slack, status is set to "Error".
  • Error Message - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs.

Error Messages:

  • Invalid Channel ID or User ID.
  • Insufficient permissions. Check OAuth token and scope permissions.
  • Forbidden request. Check OAuth token and scope permissions.
  • Invalid connection.

To use this action, a corresponding Slack connection and credential must be created and associated with the Slack Connection & Credential alias. Learn More

Note: Requires a subscription for production use. Read More.

sys_hub_flow.description:
Get User Information.

Inputs:

  • Slack User ID - User ID of a Slack user.

Outputs:

  • Status - If the request is executed successfully. Status is set to "Success". If there is a failure in Slack, status is set to "Error".
  • Error Message - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs.

Error Messages:

  • User is already present in ServiceNow.
  • Insufficient permissions. Check OAuth token and scope permissions.
  • Forbidden request. Check OAuth token and scope permissions.
  • Invalid connection.

To use this action, a corresponding Slack connection and credential must be created and associated with the Slack Connection & Credential alias. Learn More

Note: Requires a subscription for production use. Read More.

sys_hub_flow.name: Insert Slack User Details by User ID
sys_hub_flow.sys_name: Insert Slack User Details by User ID

sys_hub_flow.description:
Posts an Approval Mesage to a channel or user.

Inputs:

  • Channel ID - Unique ID of the channel or user.
  • User ID - Select user from sys_user table.
  • Approval - Record in the Sys Approval table.
  • Template - Please select the template, from which Slack Messages are displayed.
  • Additional Message - Any additional message with the approval details.
  • Icon - Sender icon emoji to be shown in the channel/DM. For example- :male-technologist:
  • Username - Sender name to be shown in the channel.

Outputs:

  • Status - If the request is executed successfully. Status is set to "Success". If there is a failure in Slack, status is set to "Error".
  • Error Message - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs.

Error Messages:

  • Invalid Channel ID or User ID.
  • Insufficient permissions. Check OAuth token and scope permissions.
  • Forbidden request. Check OAuth token and scope permissions.
  • Invalid connection.

To use this action, a corresponding Slack connection and credential must be created and associated with the Slack Connection & Credential alias. Learn More

Note: Requires a subscription for production use. Read More.

sys_hub_flow.name: Post Approval Message

sys_hub_flow.description:
Respond to Slack Approval Action.

Inputs:

  • Response Url - Url of the Slack message to replace.
  • Payload - payload of the message to send.

Outputs:

  • Status - Will be set to "Success" if the request succeeds or "Error" if a failure in Slack occurs.
  • Error message -Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs. The status will be Error only in case of any failure in Slack.

Error Messages:

  • Message text too long.
  • Message text is missing.
  • Insufficient permissions. Check OAuth token and scope permissions.
  • Forbidden request. Check OAuth token and scope permissions.
  • Invalid connection.
  • Unknown error.

To use this action, a corresponding Slack connection and credential must be created and associated with the Slack Connection & Credential alias. Learn More

Note: Requires a subscription for production use. Read More.

sys_hub_flow.description:
Get User Information.

Inputs:

  • Slack Member ID - Member ID of a Slack user.

Outputs:

  • Status - If the request is executed successfully. Status is set to "Success". If there is a failure in Slack, status is set to "Error".
  • Error Message - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs.

Error Messages:

  • User is already present in ServiceNow.
  • Insufficient permissions. Check OAuth token and scope permissions.
  • Forbidden request. Check OAuth token and scope permissions.
  • Invalid connection.

To use this action, a corresponding Slack connection and credential must be created and associated with the Slack Connection & Credential alias. Learn More

Note: Requires a subscription for production use. Read More.

sys_hub_flow.name: Password Change Master Subflow

sys_hub_flow.description:
Given table name and the sys_id of the record in the table, start point Instance Scan on the provided instance. This will internally make a call to a REST API and returns the Instance Scan progress result.

Inputs:

  • Instance URL - The URL of the Instance where you wish to start the Instance Scan .
  • Credential Alias - The Connection and Credential alias must be of type "Credential" and must have user with "sn_cicd.sys_ci_automation" role.
  • Table Name - Table Name of the target record
  • Sys Id - Target record's sys _id

Outputs:

  • Status - Will be set to "0", if the request is "Pending". Will be set to "1", if the request is in "Running" state. Will be set to "2", if the request is "Successful". Will be set to "3", if the request is "Failed". Will be set to "4", if the request is "Cancelled".
  • Error - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs.
  • HTTP Status - The HTTP status code of the response
  • Status Label - The label corresponding to the 'status'. Will be one of "Pending", "Running", "Successful", "Failed", "Cancelled"
  • Status Message - More information on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Status Detail - More details on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Progress Id - The sys_id of the execution tracker for this request. Can be used to track the progress of the request.
  • Progress URL - The URL of REST endpoint to get progress from sys_id of the execution tracker for this request.
  • Result Id - The sys_id of the result record generated from the scan
  • Result URL - The URL to the result api for a reference
  • Finding URL - The URL of the Finding table where all the findings can be found from the scan
  • Finding Label - Information to customer that 10,000 records are shown

Error Messages:

  • User does not have access to CICD role
  • Invalid Table Name
  • The scan exceeded the time allowed
  • The scan completed. However, one or more individual checks failed.

To use this action, a corresponding CICD connection and credential must be created and associated with the Instance URL used above. Learn More

sys_hub_flow.name: Instance Scan Execute Point Scan

sys_package.display_value: Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CICD) Spoke

sys_scope.display_value: Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CICD) Spoke

sys_hub_flow.description:
Start Full Instance Scan on the provided instance. This will internally make a call to a REST API and returns the Instance Scan progress result.

Inputs:

  • Instance URL - The URL of the Instance where you wish to start the Instance Scan .
  • Credential Alias - The Connection and Credential alias must be of type "Credential" and must have user with "sn_cicd.sys_ci_automation" role.

Outputs:

  • Status - Will be set to "0", if the request is "Pending". Will be set to "1", if the request is in "Running" state. Will be set to "2", if the request is "Successful". Will be set to "3", if the request is "Failed". Will be set to "4", if the request is "Cancelled".
  • Error - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs.
  • HTTP Status - The HTTP status code of the response
  • Status Label - The label corresponding to the 'status'. Will be one of "Pending", "Running", "Successful", "Failed", "Cancelled"
  • Status Message - More information on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Status Detail - More details on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Progress Id - The sys_id of the execution tracker for this request. Can be used to track the progress of the request.
  • Progress URL - The URL of REST endpoint to get progress from sys_id of the execution tracker for this request.
  • Result Id - The sys_id of the result record generated from the scan
  • Result URL - The URL to the result api for a reference
  • Finding URL - The URL of the Finding table where all the findings can be found from the scan
  • Finding Label - Information to customer that 10,000 records are shown

Error Messages:

  • User does not have access to CICD role
  • The scan exceeded the time allowed
  • Multiple Full Scans cannot run at the same time
  • The scan completed. However, one or more individual checks failed.

To use this action, a corresponding CICD connection and credential must be created and associated with the Instance URL used above. Learn More

sys_hub_flow.name: SLA notification and escalation flow

sys_hub_flow.description:
This flow will wait for a tracker to complete its progress on the provided instance and return the results of the tracker.

Inputs:

  • Progress Id - Sys Id of the sys_execution_tracker record.
  • Instance URL - The URL of the Instance where you wish to start the test suite .
  • Credential Alias - The Connection and Credential alias must be of type "Credential" and must have user with "sn_cicd.sys_ci_automation" role.
  • Interval - The time that the 'Action' in this flow periodically checks the progress of the tracker. You can add the interval either in days or hours or minutes or seconds. Default to 30 seconds.

Outputs:

  • Status - Will be set to "0", if the request is "Pending". Will be set to "1", if the request is in "Running" state. Will be set to "2", if the request is "Successful". Will be set to "3", if the request is "Failed". Will be set to "4", if the request is "Cancelled".
  • Error - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs.
  • HTTP Status - The HTTP status code of the response
  • Status Label - The label corresponding to the 'status'. Will be one of "Pending", "Running", "Successful", "Failed", "Cancelled"
  • Status Message - More information on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Status Detail - More details on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.

Error Messages:

  • User does not have access to CICD role
  • Invalid Progress ID
  • Unable to get the execution progress for the Progress Id

To use this action, a corresponding CICD connection and credential must be created and associated with the Instance URL used above. Learn More

sys_package.display_value: Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CICD) Spoke

sys_scope.display_value: Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CICD) Spoke

sys_hub_flow.description:
Given an application scope and version, this subflow will rollback the application on the provided instance

Inputs:

  • Scope - Scope name of the application you wish to rollback
  • Instance URL - The URL of the instance on which the application will be rolled back
  • Credential Alias - The connection and credential alias must be of type "Credential" and must have user with "sn_cicd.sys_ci_automation" role
  • Version - The expected version of the rolled back application

Outputs:

  • Status - Will be set to "0", if the request is "Pending". Will be set to "1", if the request is in "Running" state. Will be set to "2", if the request is "Successful". Will be set to "3", if the request is "Failed". Will be set to "4", if the request is "Cancelled”
  • Error - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs.
  • HTTP Status - The HTTP status code of the response
  • Status Label - The label corresponding to the 'status'. Will be one of "Pending", "Running", "Successful", "Failed", "Cancelled"
  • Status Message - More information on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Status Detail - More details on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Progress Id - The sys_id of the execution tracker for this request. Can be used to track the progress of the request
  • Progress URL - The URL of REST endpoint to get progress from sys_id of the execution tracker for this request

Error Messages:

  • User does not have access to CICD role
  • Missing required parameter scope
  • Unable to locate application

To use this action, a corresponding CICD connection and credential must be created and associated with the instance URL used above Learn More

sys_hub_flow.name: Rollback Application With Scope

sys_package.display_value: Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CICD) Spoke

sys_scope.display_value: Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CICD) Spoke

sys_hub_flow.description:
Given an application sys_id and version, this subflow will rollback the application on the provided instance

Inputs:

  • Sys Id - Sys Id of the application you wish to rollback
  • Instance URL - The URL of the instance on which the application will be rolled back
  • Credential Alias - The connection and credential alias must be of type "Credential" and must have user with "sn_cicd.sys_ci_automation" role
  • Version - The expected version of the rolled back application

Outputs:

  • Status - Will be set to "0", if the request is "Pending". Will be set to "1", if the request is in "Running" state. Will be set to "2", if the request is "Successful". Will be set to "3", if the request is "Failed". Will be set to "4", if the request is "Cancelled”
  • Error - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs
  • HTTP Status - The HTTP status code of the response
  • Status Label - The label corresponding to the 'status'. Will be one of "Pending", "Running", "Successful", "Failed", "Cancelled"
  • Status Message - More information on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Status Detail - More details on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.

Error Messages:

  • User does not have access to CICD role
  • Missing required parameter sys_id
  • Unable to locate application

To use this action, a corresponding CICD connection and credential must be created and associated with the instance URL used above Learn More

sys_hub_flow.name: Rollback Application With ID

sys_package.display_value: Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CICD) Spoke

sys_scope.display_value: Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CICD) Spoke

sys_hub_flow.description:
Given an application scope, this subflow will install the application on the given instance

Inputs:

  • Scope - Scope name of the application you wish to install
  • Instance URL - The URL of the instance where you wish to install the application
  • Credential Alias - The connection and credential alias must be of type "Credential" and must have user with "sn_cicd.sys_ci_automation" role
  • Version - The version of the application you wish to install

Outputs:

  • Status - Will be set to "0", if the request is "Pending". Will be set to "1", if the request is in "Running" state. Will be set to "2", if the request is "Successful". Will be set to "3", if the request is "Failed". Will be set to "4", if the request is "Cancelled"
  • Error - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs
  • HTTP Status - The HTTP status code of the response
  • Status Label - The label corresponding to the 'status'. Will be one of "Pending", "Running", "Successful", "Failed", "Cancelled"
  • Status Message - More information on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Status Detail - More details on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.

Error Messages:

  • User does not have access to CICD role
  • Missing required parameter scope
  • Application version is currently installed
  • Invalid application downgrade
  • Unable to locate application
  • Latest version is currently installed

To use this action, a corresponding CICD connection and credential must be created and associated with the instance URL used above Learn More

sys_hub_flow.name: Install Application With Scope

sys_package.display_value: Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CICD) Spoke

sys_scope.display_value: Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CICD) Spoke

sys_hub_flow.description:
Given an application sys_id, this subflow will install the application on the given instance

Inputs:

  • Sys Id - Sys Id of the application you wish to install
  • Instance URL - The URL of the instance where you wish to install the application
  • Credential Alias - The connection and credential alias must be of type "Credential" and must have user with "sn_cicd.sys_ci_automation" role
  • Version - The version of the application you wish to install

Outputs:

  • Status - Will be set to "0", if the request is "Pending". Will be set to "1", if the request is in "Running" state. Will be set to "2", if the request is "Successful". Will be set to "3", if the request is "Failed". Will be set to "4", if the request is "Cancelled"
  • Error - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs
  • HTTP Status - The HTTP status code of the response
  • Status Label - The label corresponding to the 'status'. Will be one of "Pending", "Running", "Successful", "Failed", "Cancelled"
  • Status Message - More information on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Status Detail - More details on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.

Error Messages:

  • User does not have access to CICD role
  • Missing required parameter sys_id
  • Application version is currently installed
  • Invalid application downgrade
  • Unable to locate application
  • Latest version is currently installed

To use this action, a corresponding CICD connection and credential must be created and associated with the instance URL used above Learn More

sys_hub_flow.name: Install Application With ID

sys_package.display_value: Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CICD) Spoke

sys_scope.display_value: Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CICD) Spoke

sys_hub_flow.description:
Given an application scope, this subflow will publish the application to the app-repo

Inputs:

  • Scope - Scope name of the application you wish to publish
  • Instance URL - The URL of the instance from which you wish to publish the application to app-repo
  • Credential Alias - The connection and credential alias must be of type "Credential" and must have user with "sn_cicd.sys_ci_automation" role
  • Version - The version of the application you wish to publish
  • Dev Notes - The notes that app author wants to publish for this version update

Outputs:

  • Status - Will be set to "0", if the request is "Pending". Will be set to "1", if the request is in "Running" state. Will be set to "2", if the request is "Successful". Will be set to "3", if the request is "Failed". Will be set to "4", if the request is "Cancelled”
  • Error - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs
  • HTTP Status - The HTTP status code of the response
  • Status Label - The label corresponding to the 'status'. Will be one of "Pending", "Running", "Successful", "Failed", "Cancelled"
  • Status Message - More information on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Status Detail - More details on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.

Error Messages:

  • User does not have access to CICD role
  • Missing required parameter scope
  • Unable to locate application

To use this action, a corresponding CICD connection and credential must be created and associated with the instance URL used above Learn More

sys_hub_flow.name: Publish Application With Scope

sys_package.display_value: Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CICD) Spoke

sys_scope.display_value: Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CICD) Spoke

sys_hub_flow.description:
Given an application sys_id, this subflow will publish the application to the app-repo

Inputs:

  • Sys Id - Sys Id of the application you wish to publish
  • Instance URL - The URL of the instance from which you wish to publish the application to app-repo
  • Credential Alias - The connection and credential alias must be of type "Credential" and must have user with "sn_cicd.sys_ci_automation" role
  • Version - The version of the application you wish to publish
  • Dev Notes - The notes that app author wants to publish for this version update

Outputs:

  • Status - Will be set to "0", if the request is "Pending". Will be set to "1", if the request is in "Running" state. Will be set to "2", if the request is "Successful". Will be set to "3", if the request is "Failed". Will be set to "4", if the request is "Cancelled".
  • Error - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs.
  • HTTP Status - The HTTP status code of the response
  • Status Label - The label corresponding to the 'status'. Will be one of "Pending", "Running", "Successful", "Failed", "Cancelled"
  • Status Message - More information on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Status Detail - More details on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.

Error Messages:

  • User does not have access to CICD role
  • Missing required parameter sys_id
  • Unable to locate application

To use this action, a corresponding CICD connection and credential must be created and associated with the instance URL used above Learn More

sys_hub_flow.description:
Given a Plugin Id, this flow will Rollback a plugin to the last installed version on the provided instance.

Inputs:

  • Plugin Id - ID of the Plugin you wish to rollback.
  • Instance URL - The URL of the Instance where you wish to rollback the plugin.
  • Credential Alias - The Connection and Credential alias must be of type "Credential" and must have user with "sn_cicd.sys_ci_automation" role.

Outputs:

  • Status - Will be set to "0", if the request is "Pending". Will be set to "1", if the request is in "Running" state. Will be set to "2", if the request is "Successful". Will be set to "3", if the request is "Failed". Will be set to "4", if the request is "Cancelled".
  • Error - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs.
  • HTTP Status - The HTTP status code of the response
  • Status Label - The label corresponding to the 'status'. Will be one of "Pending", "Running", "Successful", "Failed", "Cancelled"
  • Status Message - More information on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Status Detail - More details on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Progress Id - The sys_id of the execution tracker for this request. Can be used to track the progress of the request.
  • Progress URL - The URL of REST endpoint to get progress from sys_id of the execution tracker for this request.

Error Messages:

  • User does not have access to CICD role
  • Missing required parameter Plugin Id
  • Plugin Id is not valid
  • Plugin is not Active on the instance, unable to rollback
  • Rollback Context for plugin not found, verify that plugin is activated on instance.

To use this action, a corresponding CICD connection and credential must be created and associated with the Instance URL used above. Learn More

sys_hub_flow.description:
Given a Plugin Id, this flow activates a plugin on the provided instance.

Inputs:

  • Plugin Id - ID of the plugin you wish to activate.
  • Instance URL - The URL of the Instance where you wish to activate the plugin.
  • Credential Alias - The Connection and Credential alias must be of type "Credential" and must have user with "sn_cicd.sys_ci_automation" role.

Outputs:

  • Status - Will be set to "0", if the request is "Pending". Will be set to "1", if the request is in "Running" state. Will be set to "2", if the request is "Successful". Will be set to "3", if the request is "Failed". Will be set to "4", if the request is "Cancelled".
  • Error - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs.
  • HTTP Status - The HTTP status code of the response
  • Status Label - The label corresponding to the 'status'. Will be one of "Pending", "Running", "Successful", "Failed", "Cancelled"
  • Status Message - More information on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Status Detail - More details on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.

Error Messages:

  • User does not have access to CICD role
  • Missing required parameter Plugin Id
  • Plugin Id is not valid
  • Invalid License for Plugin. Unable to activate
  • [WARNING] Plugin being activated requires a license, will not allow activation in production
  • [WARNING] The plugin is already active, repair plugin to upgrade or fix.

To use this action, a corresponding CICD connection and credential must be created and associated with the Instance URL used above. Learn More

sys_hub_flow.description:
Given an ATF test suite's name, this flow will start an ATF Test Suite and give the suite execution results. Since running ATF suites is an on-demand request, a Scheduled client test runner is required for running ATF test suites.

Inputs:

  • Test Suite Name - Name of the ATF test suite.
  • Instance URL - The URL of the Instance where you wish to start the test suite.
  • Credential Alias - The Connection and Credential alias must be of type "Credential" and must have user with "sn_cicd.sys_ci_automation" role.
  • Browser Name - Browser name where you wish to run the scheduled client test runner. The browser names should be exactly matching with one of the following. "Chrome", "Firefox", "Edge", "IE", "Safari". Default to "Any"
  • Browser Version - 'Browser version starts with' of the 'Browser' where the client test runner is running. Default to "Any”.
  • OS Name - Operating System name where you wish to open the browser. The operating system names should be exactly matching with one of the following. "Windows", "Mac OS X", "Linux'. Default to "Any".
  • OS Version - 'Operating System version starts with' of the 'Operating System' you wish to use to open the scheduled client test runner. Default to "Any".

Outputs:

  • Status - Will be set to "0", if the request is "Pending". Will be set to "1", if the request is in "Running" state. Will be set to "2", if the request is "Successful". Will be set to "3", if the request is "Failed". Will be set to "4", if the request is "Cancelled”.
  • Error - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs.
  • HTTP Status - The HTTP status code of the response
  • Status Label - The label corresponding to the 'status'. Will be one of "Pending", "Running", "Successful", "Failed", "Cancelled"
  • Status Message - More information on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Status Detail - More details on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Result URL - The URL of the ATF suite execution record. You can navigate to this URL and check verify results.
  • Test Suite Duration - Total time taken to run the tests (in seconds).
  • Rolledup Test Success Count - Number of tests that are successful. This includes all the child tests that ran successfully.
  • Rolledup Test Failure Count - Number of tests that are failed. This includes all the failed child tests.
  • Rolledup Test Error Count - Number of tests that are errored. This includes all the errored child tests.
  • Rolledup Test Skip Count - Number of tests that are skipped. This includes all the skipped child tests.
  • Test Suite Name - Name of the test suite.

Error Messages:

  • User does not have access to CICD role
  • Invalid ATF Suite ID
  • ATF Schedule Run - record insert failed
  • Start ATF Suite Failed with the given Suite ID
  • Get ATF Suite Execution Results feature is not available. The property is disabled
  • Start ATF Suite With ID or Name feature is not available. The property is disabled
  • Get ATF Suite Execution Results feature is not available. The property is disabled

To use this action, a corresponding CICD connection and credential must be created and associated with the Instance URL used above. Learn More

sys_hub_flow.name: ATF Suite Start With Name

sys_package.display_value: Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CICD) Spoke

sys_scope.display_value: Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CICD) Spoke

sys_hub_flow.description:
Given an ATF test suite's id, this flow will start an ATF Test Suite on the provided instance and give the suite execution results. Since running ATF suites is an on-demand request, a Scheduled client test runner is required for running ATF test suites.

Inputs:

  • Test Suite Sys Id - Sys Id of the ATF test suite.
  • Instance URL - The URL of the Instance where you wish to start the test suite.
  • Credential Alias - The Connection and Credential alias must be of type "Credential" and must have user with "sn_cicd.sys_ci_automation" role.
  • Browser Name - Browser name where you wish to run the scheduled client test runner. The browser names should be exactly matching with one of the following. "Chrome", "Firefox", "Edge", "IE", "Safari". Default to "Any"
  • Browser Version - 'Browser version starts with' of the 'Browser' where the client test runner is running. Default to "Any".
  • OS Name - Operating System name where you wish to open the browser. The operating system names should be exactly matching with one of the following. "Windows", "Mac OS X", "Linux'. Default to "Any".
  • OS Version - 'Operating System version starts with' of the 'Operating System' you wish to use to open the scheduled client test runner. Default to "Any".

Outputs:

  • Status - Will be set to "0", if the request is "Pending". Will be set to "1", if the request is in "Running" state. Will be set to "2", if the request is "Successful". Will be set to "3", if the request is "Failed". Will be set to "4", if the request is "Cancelled”.
  • Error - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs.
  • HTTP Status - The HTTP status code of the response
  • Status Label - The label corresponding to the 'status'. Will be one of "Pending", "Running", "Successful", "Failed", "Cancelled"
  • Status Message - More information on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Status Detail - More details on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Result URL - The URL of the ATF suite execution record. You can navigate to this URL and check verify results.
  • Test Suite Duration - Total time taken to run the tests (in seconds).
  • Rolledup Test Success Count - Number of tests that are successful. This includes all the child tests that ran successfully.
  • Rolledup Test Failure Count - Number of tests that are failed. This includes all the failed child tests.
  • Rolledup Test Error Count - Number of tests that are errored. This includes all the errored child tests.
  • Rolledup Test Skip Count - Number of tests that are skipped. This includes all the skipped child tests.
  • Test Suite Name - Name of the test suite.

Error Messages:

  • User does not have access to CICD role
  • Invalid ATF Suite ID
  • ATF Schedule Run - record insert failed
  • Start ATF Suite Failed with the given Suite ID
  • Get ATF Suite Execution Results feature is not available. The property is disabled
  • Start ATF Suite With ID or Name feature is not available. The property is disabled
  • Get ATF Suite Execution Results feature is not available. The property is disabled

To use this action, a corresponding CICD connection and credential must be created and associated with the Instance URL used above. Learn More

sys_hub_flow.description:
Apply remote changes from source control using application scope on the given instance.

Inputs:

  • App Scope - Scope of the application on which you wish to apply changes from source control.
  • Instance URL - The URL of the Instance where app needs to be updated.
  • Credential Alias - The Connection and Credential alias must be of type "Credential" and must have user with "sn_cicd.sys_ci_automation" role."
  • Branch Name - Branch Name of the Git repo from which changes will be applied to application.

Outputs:

  • Status - Will be set to "0", if the request is "Pending". Will be set to "1", if the request is in "Running" state. Will be set to "2", if the request is "Successful". Will be set to "3", if the request is "Failed". Will be set to "4", if the request is "Cancelled".
  • Error - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs.
  • HTTP Status - The HTTP status code of the response
  • Status Label - The label corresponding to the 'status'. Will be one of "Pending", "Running", "Successful", "Failed", "Cancelled"
  • Status Message - More information on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Status Detail - More details on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.

To use this action, a corresponding CICD connection and credential must be created and associated with the Instance URL used above. Learn More

sys_hub_flow.description:
This flow will apply remote changes from source control on an application with a given sys_id on the provided instance.

Inputs:

  • Sys Id - Sys Id of the application on which you wish to apply changes from source control.
  • Instance URL - The URL of the Instance where app needs to be updated.
  • Credential Alias - The Connection and Credential alias must be of type "Credential" and must have user with "sn_cicd.sys_ci_automation" role."
  • Branch Name - Branch Name of the source control repo from which changes will be applied to application.

Outputs:

  • Status - Will be set to "0", if the request is "Pending". Will be set to "1", if the request is in "Running" state. Will be set to "2", if the request is "Successful". Will be set to "3", if the request is "Failed". Will be set to "4", if the request is "Cancelled”.
  • Error - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs.
  • HTTP Status - The HTTP status code of the response
  • Status Label - The label corresponding to the 'status'. Will be one of "Pending", "Running", "Successful", "Failed", "Cancelled"
  • Status Message - More information on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.
  • Status Detail - More details on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.

To use this action, a corresponding CICD connection and credential must be created and associated with the Instance URL used above. Learn More

sys_hub_flow.name: Create Case from Email

sys_hub_flow.description:
Calls appropriate subflow by using configuration variables of the provider.

Inputs:

  • Password Reset Request - Password request record.
  • New Password - Password for the user being reset.
  • Current Password - The current password of the user.

Outputs:

  • Status - Will be set to 'Success' if the request succeeds or 'Error' if a failure occurs.
  • Error Message - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs.
  • Is Flow - 'True' if the password reset process is configured to execute via Integration Hub flows. 'False' if the password reset process is configured to execute via workflows.
  • Context ID - Context Id of the workflow. Populated only when the password reset process is configured to execute via workflows

Error Messages:

Error messages for this action is populated from the corresponding subflow executed.

sys_hub_flow.name: Password Connection Test

sys_hub_flow.description:
Get a local ServiceNow user accounts lock status

Inputs:

  • Password Reset Request - Password request record.

Outputs:

  • Status - Will be set to Success if the request succeeds or Error if a failure occurs.
  • Error Message - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs.
  • Locked - True if the user is locked. False if the user is not locked. Populated only if Status is Success.

Error Messages:

  • User Inactive
  • Invalid User Record
  • Invalid Request
  • The request has no process associated with it.
  • The user associated with request is not valid.
  • The process associated with request is not valid.
  • There are more than one credential stores defined for process.
  • The credential store associated with request is not valid.

sys_hub_flow.name: Password Unlock

sys_hub_flow.annotation: Change a local ServiceNow user's password
sys_hub_flow.description:
Changes the password of an authenticated and unlocked user account to the provided new password. Verifies the new password conforms to the password format and history policies. Produces an error if the user is not authenticated or is locked out. Use “Reset Password” to unlock a locked user account and require a password change.

Inputs:

  • Password Reset Request - Password request record.
  • Current Password - The current password of the user.
  • New Password - The new password the user wants to set.

Outputs:

  • Status - Will be set to Success if the request succeeds or Error if a failure occurs.
  • Error Message - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs.

Error Messages:

  • Invalid User Record
  • User is locked
  • Invalid Request
  • The request has no process associated with it.
  • The user associated with request is not valid.
  • The process associated with request is not valid.
  • There are more than one credential stores defined for process.
  • The credential store associated with request is not valid.
  • The current password is incorrect
  • You used that password recently. Choose a different password

sys_hub_flow.name: Password Change

sys_hub_flow.annotation: Reset a local ServiceNow user password
sys_hub_flow.description:
Resets the password. Provides a temporary password and prompts user to change the password. Ensures that new password conforms to the password format and history policies.

Inputs:

  • Password Reset Request - Password request record.
  • Password - Password for the user being reset.

Outputs:

  • Status - Will be set to Success if the request succeeds or Error if a failure occurs.
  • Error Message - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs.

Error Messages:

  • Invalid User Record
  • Invalid Request
  • The request has no process associated with it.
  • The user associated with request is not valid.
  • The process associated with request is not valid.
  • There are more than one credential stores defined for process.
  • The credential store associated with request is not valid.
  • You used that password recently. Choose a different password
